triples.name: Separation logic
triples.relevance: The paper adapts separation logic to reason about Java code, making it the foundational approach being extended.

triples.name: Java (programming language)
triples.relevance: Java is the target programming language for which the thesis develops formal semantics and verification techniques.

triples.name: Abstract data type
triples.relevance: Abstract datatypes are a core modularity concept being addressed through the novel concept of abstract predicates.

triples.name: Object-oriented programming
triples.relevance: Object-oriented programming provides the modularity patterns (objects, encapsulation, inheritance) being addressed in the thesis.

triples.name: Encapsulation (computer programming)
triples.relevance: Encapsulation is one of the key modularity challenges addressed through the introduction of abstract predicates.

triples.name: Inheritance (object-oriented programming)
triples.relevance: Inheritance is the second major modularity issue addressed through abstract predicate families in the thesis.

triples.name: Visitor pattern
triples.relevance: The visitor design pattern is used as a concrete example to demonstrate the verification capabilities of abstract predicate families.

triples.name: Formal verification
triples.relevance: The paper proposes novel extensions to formal verification techniques by developing local reasoning methods adapted for Java's object-oriented features.
